https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/w8FeAVNxe17rQUqaBhKy5F0wpBf.jpg Beginning just after the bloody Sioux victory over General Custer at Little Big Horn, the story is told through two unique perspectives: Charles Eastman, a young, white-educated Sioux doctor held up as living proof of the alleged success of assimilation, and Sitting Bull the proud Lakota chief whose tribe won the American Indiansâ€™ last major victory at Little Big Horn. Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee
